name: The Black Writers Program
description: This program is a curated literary experience for Black writers to generate, develop, and share work in a supportive environment. It includes generative writing workshops, prompt-based workshops, professional development panels, and lectures. All programming is free to attend
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: The Harlem Writers Guild
description: Founded as a forum for African-American writers to develop their craft, the Harlem Writers Guild continues its mission to develop and aid in the publication of works by writers of the African diaspora
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: Center for Black Literature at Medgar Evers College, CUNY
description: For 20 years, the Center for Black Literature has had a dynamic impact on the literary field through author readings, book signings, journals, symposia, conferences, panel discussions, and writing workshops. Their programming ensures that Black literary scholarship and conversations are valued and sustained
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: midnight & indigo
description: This organization offers live, virtual classes, workshops, and seminars designed specifically for Black women writers, focusing on craft, structure, revision, and voice
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: Gotham Writers Workshop
description: Gotham Writers Workshop is a creative writing school offering a diverse range of courses for aspiring writers, praised for its experienced instructors and supportive learning environment
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: Writopia Lab
address: 155 West 81st Street, Suite A, New York, NY 10024
description: Writopia Lab fosters joy, literacy, and critical thinking in children and teens through creative writing workshops, providing inspiration and a safe space for expression
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: The Writers Studio
address: Village Community School, 272 West 10th Street, New York, NY 10014 (in-person classes)
description: Founded in 1987, The Writers Studio offers ongoing writing workshops for beginners and experienced writers, focusing on discovering and nurturing individual voices
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: The Story Studio NYC
address: New York, New York (classes held in NYC, Los Angeles, Minneapolis, and online)
description: The Story Studio teaches the art of storytelling, helping individuals turn meaningful life events into unforgettable narratives through workshops and one-on-one training
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: The Writers Room
description: The Writers Room is a nonprofit urban writers' colony providing affordable workspace in New York City, with amenities like high-speed internet and a kitchen lounge
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation

name: New York Writers Workshop
description: This organization offers writing classes, workshops, and events in partnership with authors and literary circles, dedicated to making high-quality writing education accessible. They also run a social justice initiative called Prison Writes
services: Black-owned Writing workshops in New-York consultation
